message: I'm excited to offer you a unique opportunity to acquire a high-value product. I'm looking for $1200000 for it.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1000000.
I understand you're looking for a good deal, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm offering the product for $1100000. It's a fair price considering its value.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $950000. It's a more competitive price point for the market.

I understand you're looking for a competitive price point, but I need to make sure I'm not losing money on this deal. I'm willing to compromise further, so I'm offering the product for $1050000. This is as low as I can go without losing money.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $980000, but that's as high as I can go.

I understand you're trying to stay within your budget, but I still need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you at $990000, but that's as low as I can go without losing money. It's a good deal for both of us, considering the product's value.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $980000, just like in my previous offer. I'm hoping we can meet in the middle this time.

I've already met you at $990000 and you rejected it. I'm not willing to go any lower than that. I'm willing to hold firm at $990000, but I'm open to discussing other terms if you're interested. Otherwise, I'll have to consider other options.

I understand you're firm on the price, but I'm still not comfortable with $990000. I'm willing to meet you at $975000, but that's my final offer. If I don't get a deal at this price, I'll have to consider buying from John for $1500000.
